name: Constellation by Proxy
description:
Constellation by Proxy is a roleplaying game for 2 to 4 players. It requires two (2) six-sided dice and something to write down information with. Players one and two play as two young "Executors" fighting on opposites sides of a war spanning the solar quadrant. These two Executors can both psychically connect with a Proxy: mysterious, shapeshifting techno-organic constructs discovered and weaponized by both warring factions independently. Players 3 and 4 (optionally) play as the these Proxies.

As the game opens, the Executors discover that they don't just share a connection with their Proxies--they're connected with each other, as well. 

Game by Harry Mackin (@Shiitakeharry), art by Charlie Mackin (@Charliemander13). Made for Emotional Mecha Jam.
